intro: Tetranthera trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves with three main veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. Tetranthera trinervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
